net.proteusframework.ui.column

Interface BaseDataColumnTableModel.RowDataModel<RT>

  • Type Parameters:
    RT - the row type.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    QLRowDataModel
    Enclosing class:
    BaseDataColumnTableModel<V>

    public static interface BaseDataColumnTableModel.RowDataModel<RT>
    Row data model.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

    • Method Summary

      Methods

    • Method Detail

      • canColumnSort

        boolean canColumnSort(TableDataColumn column)
        Test if the column can be sorted.
        Parameters:
        column - the column.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • getRow

        RT getRow(int row)
        Get the value at the specified row index. This is a more efficient way to do getRows().get(row)
        Parameters:
        row - the row index.
        Returns:
        the object.

      • getRowCount

        int getRowCount()
        Returns the number of rows in the model. If the number of rows cannot be efficiently determined, this method may return -1. In that case the isRowValid() method can be used to determine if a given row is valid.
        Returns:
        The number of rows or -1 if the number of rows cannot efficiently be calculated.
        See Also:
        TableModel.getRowCount()

      • getRowId

        @Nullable
String getRowId(int rowIndex)

        Get an unqiue ID for the row. This ID will be used in some mediums to find the row in the case where the model and user interface become inconsistent. When accessing the table model, the ID may be used to find the row index.

        This method may return null if not supported.

        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index.
        Returns:
        String or null if no ID is available.
        See Also:
        TableModel.getRowId(int)

      • isRowValid

        boolean isRowValid(int rowIndex)
        Returns true if the row is valid in this model. In general a row should be valid if it is less than the value of getRowCount(). Determining getRowCount() may not be efficient for all models so this method is provided to determine if a given row is valid. It is assumed that if a row is invalid, all the rows with an index greater than the row checked are also invalid.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index.
        Returns:
        true if the row is valid.
        See Also:
        TableModel.isRowValid(int)

      • setTableModel

        void setTableModel(BaseDataColumnTableModel<RT> model)
        Set the table model. This will be called by the table model.
        Parameters:
        model - the table model.

      • sortColumn

        void sortColumn(TableDataColumn column,
              SortOrder sortOrder)
        Sorts the rows for a column.
        Parameters:
        column - the column.
        sortOrder - the sort order.
